thread.title: 3 teens with guns arrested in Portland, police say
thread.title_full: 3 teens with guns arrested in Portland, police say | OregonLive.com

author: Everton Bailey Jr. | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: 3 teens with guns arrested in Portland, police say
text:
Three 18-year-olds were arrested and a trio of guns seized after patrolling police officers heard firearms falling out of the teens' parked car and hit the sidewalk near Portland's Woodlawn Park on Saturday.
Marshall C. Richmond Jr., Timothy W. Wilson, and Leontrell R. Mitchell were ordered out of the car at gunpoint around 5:40 p.m. near Northeast Claremont Avenue and Dekum Street . Two of the firearms were found on the ground near the passenger side door and Mitchell had the third weapon, according to police.
All three teens were booked into the Multnomah County Jail on suspicion of unlawful possession of a firearm and possession of a loaded firearm. Richmond and Wilson are also accused of felon in possession of a firearm.
Portland police ask anyone with information about gun-related crimes to contact the police bureau's tactical operations division at 503-823-4106 or send an email to gangs@portlandoregon.gov .
-- Everton Bailey Jr.
ebailey@oregonian.com
